Snavely McVeytown PHOTO: Nicole Swanger PHOTO: Priscilla Fultano There was quite an amazing show in the sky over south-central Pennsylvania on Thursday night. Dozens of News 8 viewers shared photos of the northern lights. Check out some of them in the gallery above. What are the northern lights? The northern lights, or aurora borealis, are a captivating phenomenon characterized by colorful dancing waves of light in the sky. When there is a strong enough geomagnetic storm, the aurora can be seen in Pennsylvania. During these storms, charged particles collide with gases in the earth's upper atmosphere, producing the spectacle. The stronger the geomagnetic storm or larger the amount of material ejected by the sun, the farther south the northern lights can be seen during a storm. Share your photos and videos with WGAL We have several ways you can show us the photos and videos you are capturing. DIRECT UPLOAD: [There is a form here to let you upload photos or video](https://www.wgal.com/upload). EMAIL: Just send to [news8@wgal.com](mailto:news8@wgal.com). JOIN OUR FACEBOOK GROUP: [Our uLocal Facebook group is here](https://www.facebook.com/groups/ulocalcentralpennsylvania).
